pr_title: fix javadoc & warning for platform refactoring

timeline.bodyText: maybe we also can or should change severity to warning
timeline.author: cdietrich

replies.bodyText: but i did not find an option
replies.author: cdietrich

replies.bodyText:
I also do not see an option. I have raised feature request https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=567968 for that.
For now, I would not remove the line, but maybe just change @link to @code.
replies.author: kthoms

replies.bodyText:
I was too eager. The option org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.invalidJavadocTagsDeprecatedRef=disableddoes it.
(Uncheck option "Report deprecated references")
replies.author: kthoms

replies.bodyText: with disabled i dont get a warning
replies.author: cdietrich

replies.bodyText: Yes, that's the consequence. Maybe the options "Report non visible/deprecated references" should also get severity drop-downs?
replies.author: kthoms

replies.bodyText: Or we go with setting all to warning. We might oversee real errors, but ATM there are none and we just have to have an eye on new warnings. Removing the comment line is IMO no option.
replies.author: kthoms

timeline.message:
fix javadoc & warning for platform refactoring

Signed-off-by: Christian Dietrich <christian.dietrich@itemis.de>

fix javadoc & warning for platform refactoring

Signed-off-by: Christian Dietrich <christian.dietrich@itemis.de>
